body.p:
Lebanon Ky
April 9: 1865
To his excellency
Thomas E. Bramlett
Governer of Ky.

Your petitioner would State that the August term 1864 of the Marion Circuit Court he with Several others were endicted for keeping a tippling house, he was at the time Keeping a hotel and had been for many years all the time aiming to Comply with all laws on the Subject but a misunderstanding with the trustees of the town and the Hotels growing out of the fact that the houses had been Closed a great deal by military authority and the trustees promised and extension of time

The grand jury being empannelled about the time found true bills against all and judgment were Confessd in all the cases petitions to your honour Stating these facts were Sent to Frankfort and you gave us twelve months respite on the part going to the State.
Executions have again Issued and t in the hands of the Sheriff and on last Monday a petition was Sent to you but my Case was omitted through mistake
Will you be so good as to remit the Balance of fine

Marion Cir Ct
vs
R. C. Harris
